Submodules

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.ExcelDocument module

The Document class represents an Excel file and provides methods to read and write its content.

class PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.ExcelDocument.Document

Bases: object

add_sheet(s: Sheet, index: int = -1)

Add a sheet to the document. If index is -1, the sheet will be added to the end of the list of sheets.

Parameters:

  • s (str) – The sheet to add.

  • index (int) – Index at which to add the sheet (default is -1).

load(file: str | BytesIO | bytes, engine: str = '', fmt: str = '')

Loads an Excel document from a file.

Parameters:

  • file (Union[str, io.BytesIO, bytes]) – The file to load. Can be a file path, a file-like object, or bytes.

  • engine (str) – The engine to use for loading the document. Default, it’s auto-detected.

  • fmt (str) – The format of the file. Default, it’s auto-detected.

property nsheets

Return the number of sheets in the workbook.

Returns:

The number of sheets in the workbook.

save(saver: None | str | BytesIO = None, engine: str = '', fmt: str = 'xlsx')

Saves the current document to a file.

Parameters:

  • saver (Union[None, str, io.BytesIO]) – The target file. If not provided, it will be saved to memory.

  • engine (str) – The engine to use for saving the document. Default, it’s auto-detected.

  • fmt (str) – The format of the file. Default, it’s “xlsx”.

Returns:

If param ‘saver’ is None, return the content as bytes. Otherwise, return None.

sheet_by_index(idx: int)

Return a Sheet object for the sheet at the given index.

Parameters:

idx – The index of the sheet (0-based).

Returns:

A Sheet object corresponding to the sheet at the given index.

Raises:

OverflowError – If the index is out of range.

sheet_by_name(name: str)

Return a Sheet object for the sheet with the given name.

Parameters:

name – The name of the sheet.

Returns:

A Sheet object corresponding to the sheet with the given name.

Raises:

KeyError – If no sheet with the given name exists.

property sheets

Return a list of Sheet objects for all sheets in the workbook.

Returns:

A list of Sheet objects.

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Register module

class PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Register.Register

Bases: object

A simple decorator-based registration system for classes.

add(engine_name: str, engine)

Add an engine to the register.

Parameters:

  • engine_name (str) – The name of the engine.

  • engine (type) – The engine class.

add_from_module(module: module, sub_class_filters: list[type], field_name: str)

Add engines from a module to the register.

Parameters:

  • module (types.ModuleType) – The module to search for classes.

  • sub_class_filters (list[type]) – A list of base classes to filter the classes by.

  • field_name (str) – The name of the field to check for.

get(engine_name: str)

Get an engine from the register.

Parameters:

engine_name (str) – The name of the engine.

Returns:

The engine class.

Return type:

type

Raises:

KeyError – If the engine is not found.

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Sheet module

class PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Sheet.Sheet(name: str)

Bases: object

Represents a sheet within an Excel file.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the sheet.

get_cell(row: int, col: int)

Gets the value of a specific cell.

Parameters:

  • row – The row index of the cell.

  • col – The column index of the cell.

Returns:

The value of the cell.

get_col(col: int)

Gets the values of a specific column.

Parameters:

col – The column index.

Returns:

A list of values in the column.

get_range(rng: CellRange)

Gets the values in a specific range.

Parameters:

rng (CellRange) – A CellRange object representing the range to get.

Returns:

A list of lists, where each inner list contains the values in a specific row.

Return type:

list[list[Any]]

get_row(row: int)

Gets the values of a specific row.

Parameters:

row – The row index.

Returns:

A list of values in the row.

ncols()

Gets the number of columns in the sheet.

Returns:

The number of columns.

nrows()

Gets the number of rows in the sheet.

Returns:

The number of rows.

set_cell(row: int, col: int, value)

Sets the value of a specific cell.

Parameters:

  • row – The row index of the cell.

  • col – The column index of the cell.

  • value – The value to set in the cell.

set_col(col: int, values: list)

Sets the values of a specific column.

Parameters:

  • col – The column index.

  • values – A list of values to set in the column.

set_range(rng: CellRange, content: list[list])

Sets the values in a specific range.

Parameters:

  • rng (CellRange) – A CellRange object representing the range to set.

  • content (list[list[Any]]) – A list of lists, where each inner list contains the values to set in a specific row.

set_row(row: int, values: list)

Sets the values of a specific row.

Parameters:

  • row – The row index.

  • values – A list of values to set in the row.
